trans-unit.source: Project: Screensaver or game
trans-unit.target: プロジェクト: Screensaver or game

trans-unit.source: Use what you now know about LEDs, coordinates, and brightness to create your own project: a screensaver, or a game.
trans-unit.target: Use what you now know about LEDs, coordinates, and brightness to create your own プロジェクト: a screensaver, or a game.

trans-unit.source: You should find a way to use coordinates in your program.
trans-unit.target: You should find a way to use coordinates in your program.

trans-unit.source: Even better, use variables to store and update your coordinates.
trans-unit.target: Even better, use variables to store and update your coordinates.

trans-unit.source: Screensavers
trans-unit.target: Screensavers

trans-unit.source: One type of project is a screensaver.
trans-unit.target: One type of project is a screensaver.

trans-unit.source: A long time ago, computers and televisions used cathode ray tube (CRT)screens for displays.
trans-unit.target: A long time ago, computers and televisions used cathode ray tube (CRT)screens for displays.

trans-unit.source: The glass screen of the display was coated on the back with phosphor, a substance that glows when painted with electrons from an electron gun at the other end of the tube.
trans-unit.target: The glass screen of the display was coated on the back with phosphor, a substance that glows when painted with electrons from an electron gun at the other end of the tube.

trans-unit.source: When the same area of the screen was painted (excited) over and over again by the stream of electrons, that part of the screen would sometimes "freeze" with the same image, burned into the phosphor for good.
trans-unit.target: When the same area of 画面 was painted (excited) over and over again by the stream of electrons, that part of 画面 would sometimes "freeze" with the same image, burned into the phosphor for good.

trans-unit.source: This was called "burn-in".
trans-unit.target: This was called "burn-in".

trans-unit.source: Normally, if a show was running, or if someone was actively using the computer, the display changed often enough that burn-in wasn’t a problem.
trans-unit.target: Normally, if a show was running, or if someone was actively using the computer, the display changed often enough that burn-in wasn’t a problem.

trans-unit.source: Programmers learned to create a demo screen with an animation that would run whenever the screen was idle.
trans-unit.target: Programmers learned to create a demo screen with an animation that would run whenever 画面 was idle.

trans-unit.source: Today, nearly all computers and television sets use LCD displays, which are not affected by burn-in.
trans-unit.target: Today, nearly all computers and television sets use LCD displays, which are not affected by burn-in.

trans-unit.source: But you can still find a screen saver in nearly every computer's Settings panel, as an opportunity to show off some neat graphics or animation.
trans-unit.target: But you can still find a screen saver in nearly every computer's Settings panel, as an opportunity to show off some neat graphics or animation.

trans-unit.source: Your task is to create:
trans-unit.target: Your task is to create:

trans-unit.source: A "screen saver" animation using the plot/unplot blocks. You can fill the screen line by line, pausing between each one, or fill it with a random constellation of stars.
trans-unit.target: A "screen saver" animation using the plot/unplot blocks. You can fill 画面 line by line, pausing between each one, or fill it with a random constellation of stars.

trans-unit.source: A game that uses sprites to manage the x and y coordinate values of the different objects.
trans-unit.target: A game that uses sprites to manage the x and y coordinate values of the different objects.

trans-unit.source: Your project might use variables to store the values of sprites, which are special structures that contain an x and a y coordinate together that describe the sprite's location as one LED on the screen.
trans-unit.target: Your project might use variables to store の値 sprites, which are special structures that contain an x and a y coordinate together that describe the sprite's location as one LED on 画面.

trans-unit.source: Project Ideas
trans-unit.target: Project Ideas

trans-unit.source: Firework screensaver
trans-unit.target: Firework screensaver

trans-unit.source: This project uses a for loop with the plot/unplot blocks to create a symmetrical design on the screen.
trans-unit.target: This project uses a for loop with the plot/unplot blocks to create a symmetrical design on 画面.

trans-unit.source: This student used a subtraction operation to get a variable that decreases as the index variable in the loop increases.
trans-unit.target: This student used a subtraction operation to get 変数 that decreases as the index variable in the loop increases.

trans-unit.source: basic.forever(() => { for (let x = 0; x <= 4; x++) { led.plot(x, 0) led.plot(0, 4 - x) led.plot(4 - x, 4) led.plot(4, x) basic.pause(50) led.unplot(x, 0) led.unplot(4 - x, 4) led.unplot(0, 4 - x) led.unplot(4, x) basic.pause(50) } })
trans-unit.target: basic.forever(() => { for (let x = 0; x <= 4; x++) { led.plot(x, 0) led.plot(0, 4 - x) led.plot(4 - x, 4) led.plot(4, x) basic.pause(50) led.unplot(x, 0) led.unplot(4 - x, 4) led.unplot(0, 4 - x) led.unplot(4, x) basic.pause(50) } })

trans-unit.source: This project uses a for loop with the plot/unplot blocks to create a symmetrical design on the screen.
trans-unit.target: This project uses a for loop with the plot/unplot blocks to create a symmetrical design on 画面.

trans-unit.source: This student used a subtraction operation to get a variable that decreases as the index variable in the loop increases.
trans-unit.target: This student used a subtraction operation to get 変数 that decreases as the index variable in the loop increases.

trans-unit.source: basic.forever(() => { for (let x = 0; x <= 4; x++) { led.plot(x, 0) led.plot(0, 4 - x) led.plot(4 - x, 4) led.plot(4, x) basic.pause(50) led.unplot(x, 0) led.unplot(4 - x, 4) led.unplot(0, 4 - x) led.unplot(4, x) basic.pause(50) } })
trans-unit.target: basic.forever(() => { for (let x = 0; x <= 4; x++) { led.plot(x, 0) led.plot(0, 4 - x) led.plot(4 - x, 4) led.plot(4, x) basic.pause(50) led.unplot(x, 0) led.unplot(4 - x, 4) led.unplot(0, 4 - x) led.unplot(4, x) basic.pause(50) } })

trans-unit.source: Cascade screensaver
trans-unit.target: Cascade screensaver

trans-unit.source: This example creates a diagonal cascading effect across the screen. Note the use of a variable (speed) to allow you to easily change the speed of the animation by changing just one number value.
trans-unit.target: This example creates a diagonal cascading effect across 画面. Note the use of 変数 (speed) to allow you to easily change the speed of the animation by changing just one number value.

trans-unit.source: Dodge ball game
trans-unit.target: Dodge ball game

trans-unit.source: This is a Dodge Ball game that uses one sprite (dodger) to try to avoid another sprite (ball).
trans-unit.target: This is a Dodge Ball game that uses one sprite (dodger) to try to avoid another sprite (ball).

trans-unit.source: You use the A and B buttons to move the dodger to avoid the balls that are falling from the top of the screen.
trans-unit.target: You use the A and B buttons to move the dodger to avoid the balls that are falling from the top of 画面.

trans-unit.source: Here is the complete Dodge Ball program.
trans-unit.target: Here is the complete Dodge Ball program.

trans-unit.source: Reflection
trans-unit.target: Reflection

trans-unit.source: Have students write a reflection of about 150–300 words, addressing the following points:
trans-unit.target: >生徒たちに以下の内容を含む１５０～３００字程度のレビューを書いてもらいましょう。:

trans-unit.source: Did you do a screensaver? A game? Something different? How did you decide?
trans-unit.target: Did you do a screensaver? A game? Something different? How did you decide?

trans-unit.source: If you did a game, what is the object of the game?
trans-unit.target: If you did a game, what is the object of the game?

trans-unit.source: How does your project use coordinates?
trans-unit.target: How does your project use coordinates?

trans-unit.source: Describe something in your project that you are proud of.
trans-unit.target: このプロジェクトであなたが一番満足していることは何ですか？

trans-unit.source: Describe a difficult point in the process of designing this program, and explain how you resolved it.
trans-unit.target: このプログラムを設計する過程で難しかったことは何ですか？ どのようにしてその問題を解決したか説明しましょう。

trans-unit.source: What feedback did your beta testers give you? How did that help you improve your design?
trans-unit.target: ベータテスターからどのようなフィードバックを得ましたか？ どのようにデザインの改善に役に立ちましたか？

trans-unit.source: Assessment
trans-unit.target: 評価

trans-unit.source: Competency scores: 4, 3, 2, 1
trans-unit.target: Competency scores: 4, 3, 2, 1

trans-unit.source: Coordinates and LEDs
trans-unit.target: Coordinates and LEDs

trans-unit.source: 4 = Uses at least 3 of the different kinds of plot/ unplot/toggle/point x y blocks in a meaningful way.
trans-unit.target: 4 = Uses at least 3 of the different kinds of plot/ unplot/toggle/point x y blocks in a meaningful way.

trans-unit.source:
* Uses variables to update coordinates.
3 = At least 2 of the different kinds of plot/unplot/ toggle/point x y blocks in a meaningful way.
2 = At least 1 of the different kinds of plot/unplot/ toggle/point x y blocks in a meaningful way.
1 = No plot/unplot/ toggle/point x y blocks are implemented.
trans-unit.target:
* Uses variables to update coordinates.
3 = At least 2 of the different kinds of plot/unplot/ toggle/point x y blocks in a meaningful way.
2 = At least 1 of the different kinds of plot/unplot/ toggle/point x y blocks in a meaningful way.
1 = No plot/unplot/ toggle/point x y blocks are implemented.

trans-unit.source: micro:bit program
trans-unit.target: micro:bit プログラム

trans-unit.source:
4 = micro:bit program:
* Uses plotted LEDs in a way that is integral to the program
* Compiles and runs as intended
* Meaningful comments in code
3 = micro:bit program lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = micro:bit program lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = micro:bit program lacks all of the required elements.
trans-unit.target:
4 = micro:bit program:
* Uses plotted LEDs in a way that is integral to the program
* 目的通りにコンパイル、実行している
* コードの中に意味のあるコメントがある
3 = micro:bit プラグラムから１つの必要な要素が欠けている。
2 = micro:bit プラグラムから２つの必要な要素が欠けている。
1 = micro:bit プラグラムからすべての必要な要素が欠けている。

trans-unit.source: Collaboration reflection
trans-unit.target: 共同作業と自己省察

trans-unit.source:
4 = Reflection piece addresses all prompts.
3 = Reflection piece lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = Reflection piece lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = Reflection piece lacks 3 of the required elements.
trans-unit.target:
4 = Reflection piece addresses all prompts.
3 = １つの項目が満たされていない。
2 = ２つの項目が満たされていない。
1 = ３つの項目が満たされていない。
